page.title: 06RECREATION PLEAN/COWIE
page.content: At school we all go swimming every week in Stirling. After school some people visit the new leisure pool in Falkirk, shortly to be officially opened by the Queen. Our teacher sometimes takes us to the dry ski slope at Polmont. Many of us enjoy horse riding. In the villages of Plean and Cowie there are amateur football teams. The older men keep racing pigeons and have contests. The West Plean and Auchenbowie Women's Club is still going strong after 60 years. The club meets fortnightly and has guest speakers, various demonstratons and whist drives. Teenagers in this area join the Young Farmers Club.
